attributes.comment:
Regarding the proposed increase in fees for immigration and naturalization
applications, I am sensitive to the increased need for national security, and
therefore for tighter controls over access to this country. However, it seems
absurd to increase costs for legal immigration so sharply when USCIS has shown
a total incompetence at keeping the millions of illegal immigrants out. If some of
the cost increase were to be targeted at enhanced border security, it might make
sense, but it appears that the fees will simply go to building a larger, more
cumbersome bureaucracy. The larger the bureaucracy, regardless of the level of
technology applied, the more likely internal problems (such as turf battles, inter-
agency rivalries, etc.) will cause entropy and gridlock, and ultimately fail to
anticipate and prevent the next threat to our security. Nothing in this proposal
guarantees an end result of faster processing and better security. It only provides
more hurdles and hoops for those aspiring to become American residents and
citizens, and does nothing to impede the dedicated enemy of the US from gaining
entry to our country. In fact, increasing the difficulty of obtaining legal entry to the
US will simply motivate potential terrorists or criminals (to say nothing of simple
honest workers looking for a better life) to seek illegal entry, as the porous borders
and lax enforcement of immigration laws makes it easier, less time consuming
and safer than submitting applications for legal entry.
